greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Van Eck sequence (cf. A181391) starting with a(1) = 3.
comment: A van Eck sequence is defined recursively by a(n+1) = min { k > 0 | a(n-k) = a(n) } or 0 if this set is empty, i.e., a(n) does not appear earlier in the sequence. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 12 2019
formula: a(n+1) = A181391(n) up to the first occurrence of a(1) = 3 in A181391. - _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 15 2019
program: (PARI) A171913_vec(N, a=3, i=Map())={vector(N, n, a=if(n>1, iferr(n-mapget(i, a), E, 0)+mapput(i, a, n), a))} \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 15 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 22 2010
ext: Name edited and cross-references added by _M. F. Hasler_, Jun 15 2019
